div.p: . ELMELEY. Bond to secure payment of £10, given by Robert Acton of Elmeley, co. Worcester, esq. to William Tornyns, clerk; signed. Dated 30 March, 30 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Worcs. 1.

[Northamptonshire] EVESHAM (Abbey of). Indenture of agreement between the Thomas de Marleberge, abbot and the convent of Evesham and Nicholas de Ely, prior and the convent of Daventry and Hugh de ..., concerning the common and pasture in the whole of the field of Baddeby and in Falevesle. [Mutilated.] [1232-6] MS. Ch. Worcs. 2.

HAMPTON (Great). Letters patent of King Henry VIII, dated at Westminster 21 July, 36 of his reign, being a licence on payment of 13s. to Richard Andrewes of Hayles and John House to alienate two messuages and two virgates of land called Carpenters howse and Hyll in Great Hampton, lately belonging to the abbey of Evesham, to Thomas Egewyn, alias Love, of Evesham. Witnessed by Queen Katherine, 'Angliae regina ac generali rectrice ejusdem'. MS. Ch. Worcs. 3,

LITTLETON (North). Indenture made 29 September, 13 Elizabeth, being a lease from the dean and chapter of Christ Church, Oxford, to Agnes Savage of Much Litleton, co. Worcester, of their tithe hay in North Litleton, for the residue of a lease formerly granted to William Sponer and others, for 56 years, at an annual rent Of 11s. [English.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 4.

PYRTON. John Lyttelton of Frankeley, co. Worcester, esq., quit-claims to Francis Folyat of Pyrton, esq., all right in lands &c. in Pyrton, alias Pyriton. Dated 30 July, 36 Hen. VIII. Signed. MS. Ch. Worcs. 5.

WORCESTER. Certificate from Bernard Betuel, minorite, vicar of the guardianship of the Holy Land, attesting the pilgrimage of William Martin, son of George Martin, of the county of Worcester, throughout the Holy Land, and his visiting all the Holy Places. Dated at Jerusalem, 19 April, 1663. MS. Ch. Worcs. 6a.

John Burton and others deliver to Roger Proctour, Nicasius Snow, and John Kente, two tenements in Worcester charged with an annual rent of 2s. 4d. for distribution to seven poor persons from the alms of the reverend father in Christ ..... Dated on the feast of St. Michael, 13 Hen. VII. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 6b.

Letters patent of King Charles II, dated at Westminster, 6th October, 35 of his reign, conferring the deanery of Worcester upon George Hicks, S.T.P., vacant by the promotion of William Thomas to the bishopric of St. David's. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 7b.

HEREFORDSHIRE; HATFIELD; WYDENHAM. Emeric Pauncefot, kt., brother and heir of Grymbald Pauncefot, grants to Walter de la Mor, son of the late John [de la Mor] of Cowarne a messuage, land, and common of pasture in Wydenham in the vill and manor of Haffeld. Dated at Madersfeld on the vigil of Pentecost, 9 Ed. II. [Slightly mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 7a.
CALDWELL (Manor), KIDDERMINSTER. The account of John Adkyns, provost, from the vigil of Mich., 37 Ed. III, to the vigil of Mich., 38 Ed. III. MS. Rolls Worcs. 1.
CALDWELL (Manor), KIDDERMINSTER The account of Thomas Brom, provost, from the vigil of Mich., 40 Ed. III, to the vigil of St. Mich., 41 Ed. III. MS. Rolls Worcs. 2.
CALDWELL (Manor), KIDDERMINSTER. The account of Richard Horton, bailiff, from the morrow of Mich., 5 Hen. VI, to the morrow of Mich., 6 Hen. VI, with a rent roll attached. MS. Rolls Worcs. 3.

FLADBURY. The accounts of Roger, the provost, and Richard de Deen, bailiff, for the manor of Fladbury, from the morrow of the feast of St. Michael, the end of the l0th year of Walter de Cantilupe, bp. of Worcester, to the feast of St. Michael, 11th [i.e. 1246-7], and of Geoffrey the provost and Thomas de Norhamptone the bailiff, of the manor of Tredinton. MS. Rolls Worcs. 4,
PIRTON FOLIOT. Court of Francis Folyat, esq., held at Pyrton the Friday next before the feast of SS. Philip and James, 28 Hen. VIII. MS. Rolls Worcs. 5.
PIRTON FOLIOT. Court of Francis Folyat, esq., held at Peryton 4 July, 36 Hen. VIII. MS. Rolls Worcs. 6.
PIRTON FOLIOT. The court baron of Thomas Folyott, esq., held at Pyrton 12 Oct., 27 Elizabeth. MS. Rolls Worcs. 7.
PIRTON FOLIOT. Court baron of Thomas Folyott, esq., held 29 March, 34 Q. Elizabeth, before Edmund Harewell, gent., seneschal. MS. Rolls Worcs. 8.
Rental of the manor of Pyrton Folliott. [Temp. Charles I.] MS. Rolls Worcs. 9.

ALCRETON. Thomas de Wyttone, chaplain, son of William de Wyttone, grants to the house of St. Wlstan, in frankalmoigne, two acres of land in Alcretone, which he had by the gift of William Galyer. Witness. Laurence de Wendleswiche, sheriff. (1240-1.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 12.

Henry Abetot of Alkerton grants to the preceptor of St. Wlstan, in frankalmoigne, a certain part of his land in the fields of Alkerton, viz. that which is called 'Wyboldeshale,' for ever. (c. 1250.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 14.

Henry Abetot of Alcreton grants to the house of the hospital of St. Wlstan, and the brethren, sisters and sick there, in frankalmoigne, two 'seeiliones' of land in Alcreton, and a plot of land in 'Scynardeshul,' for ever. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 15.

William Galien, with the assent of Agnes his wife, grants to the brethren and sisters of the hospital of St. Wlstan all claim in the service and rent of Thomas the chaplain of Witton for two acres of land in the village of Alcreton, viz. 2d. per ann., also two other rents of 1d. and ½d. from a messuage and land in Alcreton. (c. 1220-40.) Witn. William de Malverne, sheriff. MS. Ch. Worcs. 29.

BATENHALE. William le Pover, lord of Batenhale, grants to the hospital of St. Wlstan an annual rent from a mill and also a rent of one .... , in frankalmoigne, also confirms for himself and his heirs the donation of the lady Philippa de Spechesleye in the manor of Batenhale of four arrowheads and one 'troeley' . Dated at Worcester the Sunday next before the feast of St. Michael, 23 Ed. I. [Mutilated] MS. Ch. Worcs. 49.

BROMSGROVE. John de la Woningge of Bremesgrave, clerk, grants to the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan and the sick there, in frankalmoigne, the whole of a waste and a turbary and a ditch within and without a close at le Wil....., called le Walsemedewe (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 42a.

Judgment of John., prior of Lantony, and J., precentor of St. Peter's, Gloucester, delegated by pope Gregory IX, determining the rights of the Hospital of St. Wolstan and the church of Bremesgrave with respect to the chapel of Ralph de Chadeleswyz at Chadeleswyz. [With seal, lost] [1230-40] MS. Ch. Worcs. 42b.

CHADDLESWICK. William le Norreis of Chadleswich grants to the house of the hospital of St. Wlstan, and the brethren and sisters there, in frankalmoigne, a tenement which Geoffrey Berde held, and a selion of land in Sidenhale towards Haliwell, and one meadow called Hechelesmedwe, for ever. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 6.

Agnes le Norreis grants to the house of the hospital of St. Wlstan, and the brethren, sisters, and sick there, in frankalmoigne, a certain part of her land in the manor of Chadleswich, namely, that called Stonidale, which lies between the land of her sister Cristina and the land of Ysouda her other sister, together with two other parcels of land, and 4 selions, forever, (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 7.

CHADDLESWICK Cristina ..... tandi of Chadleswich grants to the sick of the hospital of St. Wlstan, in frankalmoigne, a house with a curtilage situated between her house on the upper part, and the land which was William le Norreis' near the wood of Sudwode. (c. 1250.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 27.
Fragment of a charter by which Walter de Welecumbe grants to the sick of the hospital of St. Wlstan part of his land in the manor of Chadleswich. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 30.

Walter and William de Welecumbe of Chaddlewych grant to the house of St. Wlstan and the brethren and sisters there, both well and sick, in frankalmoigne, one plot of the meadow called 'Sichemedewe' in Chaddleswych. (c. 1260.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 35.

CHADDLESWICK John, son of Roger Noppe of Chadleswych, remits and quit-claims to the preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan all his right in three halfpence annual rent from the tenements of John de Bokeden and Robert Gilbe. (c. 1280.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 37
John, son of John de Witeforde, confirms to the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan the rent granted by Emma, his mother, from her dowry in Chadleswich. (c. 1295.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 47.

Convention (indented) between the master of the hospital of St. Wolstan and Emma, who was the wife of John de Witeforde, by which the said Emma grants to the said hospital 6s. 7d. of annual rent, which she had as dowry, in the village of Chadleswich, for a term of 14 (?) years, commencing the feast of the Annunciation, 23 Ed. I. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 48.

CROWLE. Indenture dated ... after the feast of the Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin . . Rich. II, by which the master and brethren of the hospital [of St. Wolstan] demise to John Nycholes and Roger Hedun to farm, their manor of Crowele with certain stock, &c. for ... years. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 81
Bond given by the master and brethren of St. Wolstan's hospital to John Orre, vicar of Crowle, in £40. Dated in their chapter-house, 6 January, 3 Hen. IV. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 90.

CROWLE Thomas Alcoke, preceptor of the hospital of St. Wolstan, and the brethren of the same demise to farm to sir James Pratt, chaplain, and vicar of Crule, their tithes of the rectory there while he shall continue vicar, paying annually 46s. 8d. Dated at Worcester, 31 August, 1513. MS. Ch. Worcs. 107.

HADSOR. Avicia de Mauns, lady of Haddesovre, for the health of her soul, grants to the master and brethren of St. Wolstan one . . . . . by the hands of John, son of Alan, to hold to them in frankalmoigne for ever. (c. 1210-20.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 1.

HINDLIP. Geoffrey de Abetot, lord of Hindelupe, grants to St. Wolstan's, in frankalmoigne, for his soul and that of his late wife Elena, the whole of his laud under 'Olde' for ever. (c. 1270) MS. Ch. Worcs. 9.

William le Braci, lord of Warmedone, quitclaims to the preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan all his right to one culture lying under Oldebure in the manor of Hindelep. (c. 1280-90) MS. Ch. Worcs. 13.

Alexander, son and heir of sir Geoffrey D'Abitot of Hindelep, kt., quit-claims to St. Wlstan's, in frankalmoigne, all his right in ....
in the manor of Hindelep called Bekleshill, Benhull, and Swyllecroft. [Mutilated.] (c. 1280.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 18 .

Geoffrey de Abitot, lord of Hyndelep, with the consent of Alexander his son and heir, grants to the preceptor and brethren of St. Wolstan's, in frankalmoigne, all right in a piece of land which lies under Holdebury. (c. 1270-80.) [Mutilated and partly effaced.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 10.

NORTHWICK. Thomas, called Wale, of Whytinton, clerk, grants to Walter Mayel, chaplain, and William de Petlyng, clerk, all lands and tenements which he has at 'le Oeure' in the manor of Northwick, near Worcester. Dated at Worcester the Sunday next after the feast of the Conversion of St. Paul, 6 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 58.

John de Grafton, lord of Purie, for the health of his soul, gives to Walter Mayel, chaplain, William de Petlyng, clerk, and Thomas, vicar of Croule, to give and assign to the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan all lands, tenements, &c. which formerly belonged to William del Houre, and which are now in the hands of the said Walter, William, and Thomas, together with the third part of that plot of land which formerly belonged to Henry de Brocton and Margery his wife, lying near the grange of 'del Howre' in the manor of Pyrie, within the manor of Northwick. Dated at Worcester the Thursday on the feast of St. Hilary, 7 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 59.

Licence from King Edward III to the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan, Worcester, for the sum of £20, to hold the half of the manor of Pirie and a messuage in Worcester, to the value of 10 marks. [Mutilated.] [c. 1370?] MS. Ch. Worcs. 66.

Hisabeth, relict of Henry de Westmoncote, remits and quit-claims to William Carter of Worcester all right in the half of the manor of Pyrie in the village of Northwyk. Dated at Worcester the Friday after the feast of St. Gregory the pope, 22 Ed. III. Witnesses Simon Gros and Henry de Hertlebury, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 67.

NEUNETON. Thomas, son of Simon Le Seynter of Worcester, grants to the house of the hospital of St. Wlstan, and to the brethren and the sick there, 2s. of annual rent which his father gave him from the tenement of Margaret de Bruere of Neuneton, they paying annually to him and his heirs at Christmas one halfpenny, (c. 1280-90.) Witnesses John Euberne and William Colle, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 38.

CAVERNSTAKE. Matilda, relict of Reginald .... grants to the brethren and sisters of the hospital of St. Wolstan, in frankalmoigne, the whole of that part of a meadow in Northale in the manor of Cavernestok which she had of the gift of the said Reginald. MS. Ch. Worcs. 5.

SIDENHALE. Thomas, son of Walter de Longeleye, grants to the house of the hospital of St. Wlstan and the brethren there, in frankalmoigne, 10 sellions of land lying in Sidunhale, viz. those which John de Soutwode gave to him in free marriage with Felicia his daughter, (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 36.

WORCESTER. Robert de Spechleia grants to the brethren and sisters of the hospital of St. Wolstan his windmill and the site of the same above the mountain of Crestethull without the gate of Suthebur', paying annually four 'cronnocos' from the corn 'de multure' of the said mill. (c. 1220-30.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 2.

Richard Colys, citizen of Worcester, with the consent of Ingritthe his wife, grants to St. Wolstan's the whole of a curtilage with hedges and ditches, &c. without the gate of Sudbury in the suburbs of Worcester, for fifteen shillings. (c. 1270-80.) Witn. .... Upton, bailiff of Worcester. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 44.

WORCESTER Philippa, lady of .... grants to the master, brethren, and sick of the hospital of St. Wlstan, in frankalmoigne, all right and claim in a certain mill without the gate of Sudbury. Dated at Worcester the Monday after the feast of St. Dionisius, 3 Ed. I (?). [Mutilated and partly effaced.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 46.

WORCESTER William More, alias Dylewe, the master, and brethren of St. Wolstan's grant to Robert the parchment-maker and Joan his wife, a tenement without the gate of Sudbury, with the garden annexed, for 60 years. Dated at Worcester the Saturday on the feast of St. Peter ad vinc., . . . Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 84.

WORCESTER Indenture made on the feast of St. Margaret the virgin, 33 Hen. VI, by which the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to William Bathe and Joan his wife a tenement and field in Sudbury, in which they dwell, for their lives, paying yearly 10s. Witn. Richard Galyon and Richard .... , bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 103.

WORCESTER William Var ... clerk, master, and the brethren of St. Wolstan's demise to William Wyxted, walker a cottage with a small garden without Sudbury gate, also a great garden lately in the tenure of Thomas Pachet, for 14 years, at an annual rent of 6s. 8d. Dated 1 August, 9 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 105.
THORNDON. Adam le Butiller grants to the hospital of St. Wlstan one load of corn annually at Thorndon, at the feast of All Saints, (c. 1220-30?) MS. Ch. Worcs. 3.

WORCESTER. Walter, son of Richard Steyn of Wycham, quit-claims to Walter, the preceptor, and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan all right to 16d. annual rent. For this quit-claim the said master and brethren gave the said Walter 7s. Dated at Worcester the Sunday before the feast of St. Michael, 19 Ed. I. Witn. William Colle, Walter le Gnoeyse , bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 45.

WITINTON. William Amely of Wytinton quit-claims all right which he took in free marriage with Agnes his wife to Nicholas his son by the same Agnes, the whole meadow of Stanrie in Wytinton, for which one mark was given 'ad urgens negocium meum'. (c. 1230-40.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 18b .

Nicholas, son of William Ameli of Witinton, grants to Sampson the dyer, of Worcester, for 84s. the whole of the field of Stanrie, in the village of Witinton, at an annual rent of 2d. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 19.

Fragment of a charter by which Sampson the dyer, citizen of Worcester, grants to Master Walter ... .... in the village of
Wytinton, viz. that which he bought of Nicholas, son of Ameli, ... giving to him ... and to his wife ... and rendering annually one 'crennoe' of corn, of the value of 6s. Witness Sir Adam Mustel, knight.(c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 28.

WORCESTER. Robert Batayle, citizen of Worcester, grants to Robert, the porter of the bishop, a certain messuage which he took in fee of Margery Hardred, situated in Bridewritte strete, Worcester, paying to him and his heirs annually 4d. Witnesses Pagen Burgeys , William le Dusere, bailiffs of Worcester, etc. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 4a.
Richard de Aclege grants to the hospital of St. Wlstan, Worcester, an annual rent of 2s. in Dormonsiton(c. 1230.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 4b.

Walter de Wredenl ...e, master, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan grant to Robert Alewy one salt-pit, which Peter Grove formerly held of ...., paying annually 4 loads of salt (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 8.

Geoffrey Abitot, lord of Hendelep, grants to the preceptor and brethren of St. Wolstan 9d. of annual rent which he was accustomed to receive in the town of Worcester, in the street called Brideport, from a tenement of the said preceptor and brethren by the hands of Hugh Longchamp, for ever, (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 11

Richard le Seinter, citizen of Worcester, son and heir of Henry le Seynter, remits and quit-claims to the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan all right in 2s. of annual rent from a certain house which was Agnes le Meylour's, in the city of Worcester in the street of Sodebury, also another 2s. annual rent from a house which was Margery de Bruera's of Newyntone without Sodebury gate, about which there had been a dispute in the court of the city. For this quitclaim the master and brethren gave to the said Richard 16s. Witnesses Richard Coles, Adam de Pidele, bailiffs of Worcester, etc.(c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 16.

Agnes, formerly the wife of Osbert Baldrich of Worcester, grants to the ... and brethren of St. Wlstan one penny of annual rent which they were accustomed to pay her from land in the suburb of Worcester. For this grant the said hospital gave her in hand 3s. 6d. Witness Richard Blund, William le Franceis, provosts of Worcester. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 17.

Nicholas Alleheyl of Worcester, chaplain, grants to the master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan his tenement which he bought of Thomas de Lychesfeld, citizen of Worcester, in the Glovers' street. Witnesses William Rockulf, Walter le ...., bailiffs of Worcester, (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 20.

Alice, formerly the wife of Hugh Linchamp of Poywyke, remits and quit-claims to the preceptor and brethren of St. Wlstan all her right in a certain annual rent of 15d. assigned to her at her marriage at the church door from a tenement in Worcester in Brideport street. Witnesses John Enberne, William Colle, bailiffs of Worcester.(c. 126070.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 21.

Matildis le Kimbestere of Worcester remits and quit-claims, in frankalmoigne, to the master and brethren of St. Wlstan all her right in a certain tenement in 'glovers stret' [in Worcester]. Witnesses William Rochoulf, Henry de Astone, bailiffs of Worcester. (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 22.

Thomas de Lychesfelde, citizen of Worcester, with the consent of Alice his wife, grants to Nicholas Alleheyl, chaplain, for 10s., the whole of a tenement in Glovers' street, Worcester, paying annually for all services 8d. Witnesses William Rockulf, Walter le ...., bailiffs of Worcester. At Hockeday. (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 23.

Charter by which Agnes, widow, grants to Walter her son a messuage in Worcester which .... son of ... gave her in marriage-dowry at the church door. Witnesses Richard le Blund, Ralph 'socio', provosts of Worcester. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 24.

John Grene, glover, of Worcester, grants to William le Noreys, baker, citizen of Worcester, for 20s. a tenement in 'Gloveres strete' [in Worcester] for ever, paying to the preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan annually 4s. 6d. Witnesses John de ...., John ...., bailiffs of Worcester (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 25.

Walter de Moveyrun grants to John de Hales .... part of his laud in Heffemor [
Chaddleswick], for half a mark, paying annually for the same 4 1/4d. in silver, (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 26.

Worcester Grant by Adam de Kembestereson, citizen of Worcester, to John Hoho, of a messuage in Gloverestrete, paying annually 4d. Witnesses Henry Caynteselt, Robert Poywik, bailiffs of Worcester. (c. 1260) [slightly mutilated]. MS. Ch. Worcs. 32

William Cook ('Cocus'), citizen of Worcester, and Juliana called Seely his wife grant to the house of the hospital of St.Wolstan and the brethren and sick there 8d. of annual rent which the said hospital was accustomed to pay them, for a parcel of land near Losemer. Dated 1261, the Tuesday before Palm Sunday. MS. Ch. Worcs. 31.

John Hoho, citizen of Worcester, remits and quit-claims to the preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan all right and claim in a messuage in 'Gloveres strete' [in Worcester] which he had of the gift of Adam de Kembesteresone. (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 33-

Worcester John le Seynturer, citizen of Worcester, remits and quit-claims to the preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan all his right in a certain tenement which Nicholas de Egge delivered to him for the term of the life of the said Nicholas. Witn. William Colle, Walter le Veyse, bailiffs of Worcester, etc. (c. 1280-1.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 34.

[Worcester] William Cook ('Cocus'), citizen of Worcester, and Juliana, daughter of .... Seli his wife, remit and quit-claim to the preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan all their right in a certain parcel of land without the gate of .... receiving annually from the hospital 8d. for all services; for which one .... of corn was given them. Witn. Nicholas Handlo, justiciar of the king, Pagan ... and William le Disser, provosts of Worcester., (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 39.

Agnes, relict of Richard Steyn of Wychio, remits and quit-claims to the brethren of the hospital of St. Wlstan all her right in a messuage in the suburb of Worcester, which they held of her husband Richard. [Mutilated]. (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 40.

William Halyday of Worcester remits and quit-claims to the master, brethren and sick of the hospital of St. Wlstan all his right in a tenement in the street called Brutteport in Worcester, which he had by the gift of Gilbert son of John le Sockere of Wytheneford. Witn. William Botulf, Walter Coynterel, bailiffs of Worcester.(c. 1270.) MS. Ch. Worcs. 41.
[Worcester?] John de W... grants to St. Wolstan's, in frankalmoigne, annual rents of .... shillings and ... pence [Mutilated and partly effaced.] (c. 1280-90) MS. Ch. Worcs. 43.

Philip le Espicer, citizen of Worcester, grants to Cristina, daughter of William atten Apelton, the whole of a tenement in the street called Eports in Worcester for ever. For this donation the said Cristina gave him 100s. sterling. Dated at Worcester the Wednesday next after the feast of the apostles SS. Peter and Paul, 3 Ed. II. Witnesses William Roculf and Adam Pyre, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 50.

Simon Geffrey, citizen of Worcester, and Edith .... grant to Richard Coliz, citizen of Worcester, and Ingritha his wife a curtilage in Worcester. Dated at Worcester the Thursday in Easter Week ... Witn. Ricahrd de Evesham, bailiff of Worcester. [c. 1300-10] [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 51.

[Worcester] Agnes, daughter and heir of John le Hopere, brother and heir of William, son and heir of .... Hopere, citizen of Worcester, quitclaims to John of All Saints, barber and citizen of Worcester, all her right in land near the chapel of the Holy Trinity. Witn. William del Stowe and Roger Cony, bailiffs of Worcester. Dated on the feast of the Conversion of St. Paul 8 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Worcs. 52.

[Worcester] Henry, son of Henry de Bereham, grants to Roger de Barden and Isabella his wife all the tenements which he had by demise of the said Roger. Dated the Sunday after the feast of St. Peter in Cathedra, ... Ed. II. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 53.

Nicholas le Taillour, citizen of Worcester, and Cecilia, relict of Walter Gros, his wife, grant to Agnes de Staneweye a tenement in the city of Worcester. Ten marks of silver paid for the same. Dated at Worcester the Wednesday next before the feast of St. Dunstan, archbp., 12 Ed. II. Witn. William Rokulf, junior, and William de .odyntone, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 54.

Richard de la Misericorde and Lucy his wife grant to Thomas le Orbatour and Sarah his wife for 5 marks the whole of a tenement in Worcester. Dated at .... the Saturday on the vigil ... Ed. II. Witn. William Rokulf and Adam de Pyrie, bailiffs of Worcester. [Partly effaced.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 55

[Worcester] An acquittance given by William Colis, citizen of Worcester to the master and brethren of St. Wolstan's, Worcester, for the payment of .... marks for a certain messuage where Peter de Rougemount used to dwell, and for land given to them. Friday after the feast of St Dunstan, ... Ed. II. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 56.
William de Ombresleye of Worcester grants to William Carter four acres of land in divers parcels in .... near Worcester. [c. 1300] [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 57.

[Oxfordshire?] Indulgence of John, bishop of Winchester, dated at Godestowe 12 Kl. August, 1332, giving 20 days to all who may assist some church in the diocese of Lincoln. [In large part obliterated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 57b.

[Worcester] Agnes, daughter of William de la Grene of Bromleye, remits and quit-claims to William le Carter, citizen of Worcester, all her right in certain arable land behind the close of the friars minor of Worcester, which Cristina Golafre holds as dowry, and gave to Thomas de Bromeley, clerk, whose heir the said Agnes is. Dated at Worcester the Tuesday on the feast of St. Bartholomew, 7 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 60.

John of All Saints, barber and citizen of Worcester, grants to William de Swanebourne and Margery, daughter of the said John, in free marriage, and to their heirs, a messuage in Worcester in the parish of St. Nicholas near the chapel of the Holy Trinity. Dated at Worcester the Thursday on the feast of St. Wolstan the confessor, 8 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 61.

Stephen de Morton staying at ... in Staffordshire remits and quit-claims to William, called Carter of Worcester, all demands he may have against him with regard to the manor of Pyrie. Dated at Bromleye Abbates the Thursday before the feast of St. Michael, 8 Ed. III. [Slightly mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 62.

[Worcester] Walter Mayel, chaplain, appoints John de Hornygwold of Worcester his attorney to give seisin to William le Carter of Worcester of a tenement formerly Roger de Staneweye's, near the gate of the priory of Worcester. Dated at Worcester the Friday next after the feast of St. Giles, abbot, 8 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 63.

John Lory, senior, citizen of Worcester, remits and quit-claims to sir William Loebury, clerk, son and heir of Richard de Loebury, formerly citizen of Worcester, and Peter de Groete all right in a shop, in the High Street, Worcester, also all right of action, demand, &c. against the said William and his father and mother Richard and ... . Witn. Simon Groz and Richard le Chaundiller, bailiffs of Worcester. Dated at Worcester, 26 December, 9 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 64.
The will of Nicholas Contre, made the Tuesday on the vigil of the Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin, 1348 [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 65.
The will of Alice de la Wode, dated Easter Day, 1349. MS. Ch. Worcs. 68.

Elena atte Wod grants and confirms to John de . . . . lowe a tenement in Worcester. Dated at Worcester on St. James' Day, 23 Ed. III. WItn. Simon Gros and Roger de Walton, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 69.

William Rocolft, son and heir of William Rocolft, citizen of Worcester, remits and quit-claims to Thomas Carter all his claim in a plot of land in Nyelderestret in Worcester. Dated at Worcester the Monday next after the feast of St. John ante port. Lat., 41 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 70.

Agnes, daughter of William de la Grene, grants to William le Carter, citizen of Worcester, all her right in a meadow and an acre of land called ' la Sperte.' Dated ... 7 Ed. III. [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 71.

Laurence Foyer of Schryvenham, master of the hospital of St. Wolstan, and the brethren of the same, grant one chaplain of their brethren to celebrate divine offices each day in the hospital church for the souls of Thomas Carter, late citizen of Worcester, John and Aline his father and mother, and Henry and William, brothers of the said Thomas, with distribution of various doles; for which the executors of the said Thomas give a moiety of the manor of Pirye, several parcels of land and two messuages in Frerestrete, Worcester. Dated in their hospital the Monday next after the feast of St. Michael, 1369. MS. Ch. Worcs. 72.
Fragment of an indenture, dated Saturday before St. Mathias, 23 Ed. III, of an agreement between the hospital of St. Wolstan and William Gray. MS. Ch. Worcs. 73.

Charter by which John [le Botiller] of Wyche and Alice his wife, relict of Thomas Routhale, citizen of Worcester, remit and quit-claim to John de Loddelouwe, [shoemaker?], of Worcester, all their right which they had as dowry or otherwise in a tenement which was the aforesaid Thomas's in Worcester, and formerly Nicholas Couenetry's corviser. Dated at Worcester the Saturday next after the feast of SS. Simon and Jude, 43 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Worcs. 74.

Charter (indented) by which the master and brethren of St. Wolstan's hospital grant to Richard Bruggman and Alice his wife certain lands in Clyfton for a term of 50 years, they paying anuually to the said master and brethren 2s. Dated in their chapter-house on the feast of SS. Peter and Paul, 9 Rich. II. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 75.

Charter (indented) by which William Dylew, preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan demise to John Gybbe of Chaddelwich and Agnes his wife one ridge, a croft and eight selions of land in the field called 'le Wetheye,' the meadow called Kumbewelle, and other pieces of land, for 60 years, at annual rents. Dated at Worcester, 14 November, 10 Rich. II ('decimo ....') [Mutilated]. MS. Ch. Worcs. 76.

John Chadesley and Isabella his wife grant to John Putte, hosyer, the whole of a tenement in Worcester. Dated at Worcester the Friday in the third week [of Lent] 13 Rich. II. Witn. ..s... , Richard Halle, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 77.

Indenture of inventory of farm-goods delivered by the master and brethren of the hospital of St Wolstan, with a lease of the manor of Crowele, to John Nycholas and Roger Hedun. Dated ... after the Annuciation, ... Richard II [Slightly mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 81

"William Dylou, master, and the brethren of St. Wlstan's, for a certain sum of money in hand paid for the use of their church, grant to Thomas Croke of Bodyntone (?) meat, drink, and a new chamber during his life. Dated in their chapter-house on the vigil of All Saints, 19 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Worcs. 78.

The master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan demise to William Cheylemerch of Worcester, a shop with a solar in the High Street, Worcester, for 20 years. Dated in their chapter-house on the feast of the Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin, 19 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Worcs. 79a.

William More, master or preceptory of the house of hospital of St. Wolstan, grants to Richard Russel and Margaret his wife, for their lives, food and a house. Dated the Monday next after the feast of All Saints, 20 Rich. II. [With seal of the grantees.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 79b.

Charter (indented) by which William More, master, and the brethren of St. Wolstan grant to their brother Henry Serehaunt .... a corrody so long as he is able to celebrate ... Dated in their chapter-house the Monday after the feast of St. Michael, 21 Rich. II. [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 80.

William More, master, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to William Taylor and Letitia his wife a chamber in their hospital for their lives. Dated in their chapter-house the Saturday after the octave of Easter, 22 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Worcs. 82.

William More, alias Dylewe, master, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to Nicholas Bayly of Bytterley and Sibil his wife, for a certain sum of money in hand paid, a corrody for the term of their lives of bread, beer, and a chamber, the said Nicholas repairing the walls and barns, etc., and superintending the threshing and winnowing. Dated in their chapter-house the Wednesday on the feast of St. Wlstan, 2 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 83.

William More, alias Dylewe, master, and the brethren of St. Wolstan's grant to Randolph Hyde and Sibil his wife, for the term of their lives, a corrody. Dated in their chapter-house the Saturday next after the feast of All Saints, 2 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 85.

The master and brethren of St. Wolstan grant to William Braye, clerk, rector of .... a tenement with a garden annexed .... Dated at Worcester on the feast of St. Matthew, apostle, . . . Henry IV. [A fragment. Duplicate of Ch. Worcs. 86b.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 86a.

William More, alias Dylewe, master of the hospital of St. Wolstan, Worcester, and the brethren of the same grant to William Braye, clerk, rector of the church of St. Clement, Worcester, their tenement without Sudbyregate, with the garden annexed, now held by Robert Parchemener; also an annual rent of 10s. going out of their meadow in Duydeley, for his life, at a yearly service of one red rose at the feast of St. John the Bapt. Dated at Worcester on the feast of St. Matthew the apostle, 6 Henry IV. [With fragment of seal of the hospital.] [Torn.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 86b.

William More alias Dillue, master, and the brethren and sisters of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to Simon Kendale, the proctor of the hospital, a corrody for his life. Dated the Monday next after the feast of the purification of B. V. M., 7 Hen. IV. [Partly obliterated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 87,

[Worcester?] Lease from the Master and Brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan to Robert le Parchemener and Joan his wife of a tenement for 60 years. Dated Saturday in the feast of St Peter in chains, [6] Henry IV. [Much mutilated and defaced.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 54

The master and brethren of St. Wolstan grant to William Breyham, chaplain, a tenement near the gate of the hospital for the term of his life. Dated in the chapter-house the Monday on the morrow of St. Thomas apostle, 6 or 12 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 88.
The master and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan and St Godwel appoint John ... and Geoffrey More their agents to collect alms. Dated at Worcester, 2 [Illegible.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 89.
Bond from the hospital for payment of £40 to John Orre, vicar of Crowle. Dated 6 Jan. 3 Hen. IV. [For the most part effaced.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 91 .

William More, alias Dylewe, the master and preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wulstan grant to Nicholas Bailly and Sibille his wife a corrody. Dated in their chapter-house .... 20 Apr. 4 Hen. IV. [Partly mutilated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 92.

William More, alias Dylewe, the master and preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to Robert .... and Margaret his wife a corrody. Dated at 'seint Wolstanes' .... 4 Hen. IV. [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 93.

William More, alias Dylewe, the master, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wulstan grant to Ralph Symondes and Alice his wife a messuage which John Hillary held, within the liberty of Worcester, and 27s. 4d. annual rents for the term of their lives, by the name of a corrody. Dated at Worcester, 3 November, 5 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 94.
Duplicate charter. [See MS. Ch. Worcs. 94.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 95.

William More, master, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to Walter Haleway, tyler and citizen of Worcester, and Joan his wife, one parcel of land in Worcester for 60 years, at an annual rent of 13s. 4d. Dated in their chapter-house the Saturday after the feast of All Saints, 5 Hen. IV. Witn. John Bredon, Robert ..toner, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 96.
Fragment of a charter. Apparently a grant by John ... to William ... . Dated at Worcester, 7 Hen. IV. Witn. .... and ....warde, bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 97.

Thomas Ballyng, preceptor and brethren of St. Wolstan's grant to Thomas Dylewe a field called 'Falklyffeld' and a parcel of meadow for 30 years, at an annual rent of 13s. 4d. Dated at Worcester the Monday before the feast of St. Michael, 12 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 98.

Richard Oseney of Worcester grants to Master Walter London, the preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan, for ever, for ten marks, all his right in six cottages and gardens in Worcester. Dated at Worcester on the feast of St. Michael, 12 Hen. VI. Witn. William Bowrztone, one of the bailiffs of Worcester. MS. Ch. Worcs. 99.
Fragment, for the most part effaced, of an agreement between William [More], preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan, and Richard ... . 3 Henry IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 91

Walter London, the preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan covenant with Richard Oseney of Worcester, for them and
their successors, that during the life of the said Richard their chaplains shall when celebrating mass pray for his good estate, &c., and that after his death, viz. upon the anniversary of Thomas Carter, the chaplains shall when celebrating commemorate him in their prayers. Dated in the hospital on St. Michael's day, 12 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Worcs. 100.

John Garner, rector of Rothampton, co. Gloucester, grants to master Henry Breece ... and Margaret his wife of Worcester, a tenement in Worcester for 54 years, at an annual rent of 6s 8d., which the said John had by grant of the lady Elizabeth Wotton, prioress of the nunnery of Wytston, near Worcester. Dated at Worcester on St. Michael's day, 25 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Worcs. 101.

John Stokes, the preceptor, and the brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan demise to William Vytter and Rose his wife their newly-built tenement in the suburbs of Worcester for 30 years, paying yearly 20..... Dated ... 4 Ed. IV. [One half obliterated.] MS. Ch. Worcs. 102.

The preceptor and brethren of the hospital of St. Wolstan grant to John .... of Worcester three small cottages for a term of 20 years, at a rent of i2s. annually. Dated at Worcester on the feast of the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, 4 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Worcs. 104.

Commission from Silvester, bp. of Worcester, to Thomas Alcoke, master of the hospital of St. Wolstan, appointing him commissary for the diocese of Worcester. Dated at London, 6 November, 1501. MS. Ch. Worcs. 106.

Decree of Thomas Alcoke, as vicar-general of the bishop of Worcester, concerning a dispute between Hugh Morice, alias Vaughan, rector of the parish church of St. Martin, Worcester, and John Burton, master of the hospital of St. Wolstan, with the renunciation by the former of an unjust claim to tithes from William Lane for land belonging to the hospital; attested by James Botiller, clerk, of Dublin diocese, notary. Dated 20 January, 1501. [Mutilated]. MS. Ch. Worcs. 108.
WORCESTER (Preceptory of St. Wolstan). The account of Robert Style, collector of the rents, from Michaelmas, 22 Ed. IV, to the same feast, 1 Rich. III. MS. Rolls Worcs. 1 .
(Preceptory of St. Wolstan) The account of Robert Style from Michaelmas, 2 Hen. VII, to 3 Hen. VII. MS. Rolls Worcs. 2.
